column4: Kuja:_ I have used Infineon, TwinMOS, and now Kingston (ValueRam) but have also used vanilla OEM RAM chips and never had a problem so far :)
runpain:_ please, for your own safety, *don't* login as root user. There are many reasons why Ubuntu does not allow it
actually I don't like the sudo thingy, I have root enabled but I (usually) know what I'm doing :p
or you can run "sudo passwd root" and enter a root password. Then open a terminal, login as root, as use it for administrative tasks.
please don't recommend that in a channel for new users
see /msg ubotu root for Ubuntu's default way of doing things
there is one around somewhere
but it doesn't seem half as mature
http://beranger.org/index.php?article=1221
so why do you need a k3b-GTK replacement? :P
looks pretty clear to me. Nice little quick options. Edit it to have whatever you want
You mean K3b ?
yes
I know K3b very well, I just wish it was native gnome. I mean, I can make it look like a gnome app, but it doesn't feel like a gnome app (because it isn't)
kde apps are like that; they're allergic to ugliness!! </troll>
so you are a fellow kubuntista
So am I. KIO Slave forever lol
I actually hate a *lot* of stuff regarding msn messenger's usability
*especially* the latest one
I agree, but it's still *fun* to use
what feels bloated? MSN messenger?
no, openoffice does :p
